content:
TransformCollection Class

In this Article

Represents a collection of Transform objects that can be individually accessed by index.

Syntax

Declaration

public sealed class TransformCollection : System.Windows.Media.Animation.Animatable, System.Collections.Generic.ICollection<System.Windows.Media.Transform>, System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<System.Windows.Media.Transform>, System.Collections.Generic.IList<System.Windows.Media.Transform>, System.Collections.IList

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • Object
  • DispatcherObject
  • DependencyObject
  • Freezable
  • System.Windows.Media.Animation.Animatable
  • TransformCollection

Remarks

Except as noted, members of this class behave exactly as described by the IList<T>, ICollection<T>, and IEnumerable<T> documentation.

Freezable Features: Because it inherits from the Freezable class, the TransformCollection class provides several special features: TransformCollection objects can be declared as , shared among multiple objects, made read-only to improve performance, cloned, and made thread-safe. For more information about the different features provided by Freezable objects, see the Freezable Objects Overview.

XAML Implicit Collection Usage

<object>  
  <object.property>  
    oneOrMoreTransformObjectElements  
  </object.property>  
</object>

XAML Values

oneOrMoreTransformKeyFrameObjectElements
One or more Transform objects, declared using object element syntax.

Constructors summary

TransformCollection()

Initializes a new instance of the TransformCollection class.
TransformCollection(IEnumerable<Transform>)

Initializes a new instance of the TransformCollection class that contains items copied from the specified collection of Transform objects and has the same initial capacity as the number of items copied.
TransformCollection(Int32)

Initializes a new instance of the TransformCollection class with the specified capacity.

Properties summary

Count

Gets the number of items contained in the TransformCollection.
Item(Int32)

Gets or sets the Transform at the specified index.

Methods summary

Add(Transform)

Adds a Transform to the end of the TransformCollection.
Clear()

Removes all items from the TransformCollection.
Clone()

Creates a modifiable clone of this TransformCollection, making deep copies of this object's values. When copying dependency properties, this method copies resource references and data bindings (but they might no longer resolve) but not animations or their current values.
CloneCore(Freezable)
CloneCurrentValue()

Creates a modifiable clone of this TransformCollection object, making deep copies of this object's current values. Resource references, data bindings, and animations are not copied, but their current values are.
CloneCurrentValueCore(Freezable)
Contains(Transform)

Determines whether the TransformCollection contains the specified Transform.
CopyTo(Transform[],Int32)

Copies the items of the TransformCollection to an array, starting at the specified array index.
CreateInstanceCore()
FreezeCore(Boolean)
GetAsFrozenCore(Freezable)
GetCurrentValueAsFrozenCore(Freezable)
GetEnumerator()

Returns an enumerator that can iterate through the TransformCollection.
IndexOf(Transform)

Determines the index of the specified item in the TransformCollection.
Insert(Int32,Transform)

Inserts a Transform into the TransformCollection at the specified index.
Remove(Transform)

Removes the first occurrence of the specified Transform from the TransformCollection.
RemoveAt(Int32)

Removes the Transform at the specified index.

Constructors

  • TransformCollection()

    Initializes a new instance of the TransformCollection class.

    public TransformCollection ();
  • TransformCollection(IEnumerable<Transform>)

    Initializes a new instance of the TransformCollection class that contains items copied from the specified collection of Transform objects and has the same initial capacity as the number of items copied.

    public TransformCollection (System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<System.Windows.Media.Transform> collection);

    Parameters

    • collection
      IEnumerable<Transform>

      The collection whose items are copied to the new TransformCollection.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      collection is null.

  • TransformCollection(Int32)

    Initializes a new instance of the TransformCollection class with the specified capacity.

    public TransformCollection (int capacity);

    Parameters

    • capacity
      Int32

      The number of Transform objects that the collection is initially capable of storing.

Properties

  • Count

    Gets the number of items contained in the TransformCollection.

    public int Count { get; }

    Property Value

    • Int32

      The number of items in the TransformCollection.

  • Item(Int32)

    Gets or sets the Transform at the specified index.

    public System.Windows.Media.Transform this[int index] { get; set; }

    Parameters

    • index
      Int32

      The zero-based index of the Transform to get or set.

    Property Value

    • Transform

      The Transform at the specified index.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentException

      value is null.

    • ArgumentOutOfRangeException

      index is not a valid index in the TransformCollection.

    • NotSupportedException

      The TransformCollection is read-only.

      - or -

      The TransformCollection has a fixed size.

    Remarks

    Unlike typical implementations of Item, this implementation throws an ArgumentException if you attempt to insert a null (Nothing) reference.

  • Add(Transform)

    Adds a Transform to the end of the TransformCollection.

      The TransformCollection has a fixed size.

  • Clear()

    Removes all items from the TransformCollection.

    public void Clear ();

    Exceptions

    • NotSupportedException

      The TransformCollection is read-only.

    Remarks

    This method does not change the capacity of the TransformCollection.

  • Clone()

    Creates a modifiable clone of this TransformCollection, making deep copies of this object's values. When copying dependency properties, this method copies resource references and data bindings (but they might no longer resolve) but not animations or their current values.

    public System.Windows.Media.TransformCollection Clone ();

    Returns

    • TransformCollection

      A modifiable clone of the current object. The cloned object's stem.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen* property will be false even if the source's stem.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen* property was true.

    Remarks

    This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen Freezable objects (or any Freezable object). For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.

    For more information, see Clone.

  • CloneCore(Freezable)
    protected override void CloneCore (System.Windows.Freezable source);

    Parameters

    • source
      Freezable

      To be added.

    Creates a modifiable clone of this TransformCollection object, making deep copies of this object's current values. Resource references, data bindings, and animations are not copied, but their current values are.

    Returns

    • TransformCollection

      A modifiable clone of the current object. The cloned object's stem.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen* property will be false even if the source's stem.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen* property was true.

    Remarks

    This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen Freezable objects (or any Freezable object). For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.

    For more information, see CloneCurrentValue.

  • Contains(Transform)

    Determines whether the TransformCollection contains the specified Transform.

    public bool Contains (System.Windows.Media.Transform value);

    Parameters

    • value
      Transform

      The Transform to locate in the TransformCollection.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if the Transform is found in the TransformCollection; otherwise, false.

  • CopyTo(Transform[],Int32)

    Copies the items of the TransformCollection to an array, starting at the specified array index.

    public void CopyTo (System.Windows.Media.Transform[] array, int index);

    Parameters

    • array
      Transform[]

      The one-dimensional array that is the destination of the items copied from the TransformCollection. The array must have zero-based indexing.

    • index
      Int32

      The zero-based index in array at which copying begins.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      array is null.

    • ArgumentOutOfRangeException

      index is less than zero.

    • ArgumentException

      array is multidimensional.

      -or-

      The number of items in the source TransformCollection is greater than the available space from index to the end of the destination array.
